page.title: 07The Diving Centre and Wrecks
page.content: This is situated on the E.side of the Landing Beach.Lundy provides excellent diving.The island's position,at the edge of the Atlantic,mixes oceanic waters with the rich flows of the Bristol Channel.The spectacular underwater scenery combines deep gullies,boulder strewn plains and a multitude of artificial'wreck'reefs. Throughout history Lundy has been a danger to shipping,either as a haunt of pirates or physically.Its sheer cliffs and jagged rocks have destroyed paddle-steamers,sailing ships,fishing and cargo vessels and even a battleship!The first records are of the Wye in 1796 and the most recent the Kaaksburg in 1980.Barely 10% have been found so there is a chance for new finds! Lundy is one of the best sites in the UK.for underwater photography.{(cont.)
